uk.ac.ox.cs.diadem.oxpath.utils

Class OXPathMemoizerNaive

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ox.cs.diadem.oxpath.utils.OXPathMemoizerNaive
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InvocationHandler, OXPathCache

    public class OXPathMemoizerNaive
extends Object
implements InvocationHandler, OXPathCache
    This class is a general java memoizer that was retrieved from http://onjava.com/pub/a/onjava/2003/08/20/memoization.html?page=2 on 24 Sept 2011. It is useful in OXPath for both the memoization feature in eval_ as well as the extraction marker creation.

    The class here has been adapted from its original verison to update generics to parameterized types (rather than the raws of pre-Java 1.5). In addition, for efficiency, we memoize methods only whose first parameter is a DOMNode instance (each such method signature, then, must be unique as we don't account for the name). This way, we can cache by the containing document, rather than the method.

    Author:
    Tom White, AndrewJSel

      • clear

        public Boolean clear(DOMDocument page)
        Description copied from interface: OXPathCache
        Clears all memoized data for the input DOMDocument. Will be overridden as long as a proxy object is used (should always be used for OXPath classes overridding this method).
        Specified by:
        clear in interface OXPathCache
        Parameters:
        page - DOMDocument we are removing all memoized results for, presumably because the page is being closed in PAAT
